_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Good bodily conduct [an1.294-295:1.2]: It is impossible for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from good bodily conduct.
It is possible for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from good bodily conduct.
Good verbal and mental conduct (a causal: It is impossible for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from good verbal and mental conduct.
It is possible for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from good verbal and mental conduct.

It is impossible that someone who has engaged in good verbal and mental conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
It is possible that someone who has engaged in good verbal and mental conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, heavenly realm.
Bad bodily conduct (a causal chain) [an1: It is impossible that someone who has engaged in bad bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

It is possible that someone who has engaged in bad bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
Bad verbal and mental conduct (a causal: It is impossible that someone who has engaged in bad verbal and mental conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

It is possible that someone who has engaged in bad verbal and mental conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
Good bodily conduct (a causal chain) [an: It is impossible that someone who has engaged in good bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a place of loss, the underworld, a lower realm, hell.
It is possible that someone who has engaged in good bodily conduct could, for that reason alone, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
